decks.notes: This deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay with a mix of control elements. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while deploying evasive creatures like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Faerie Miscreant to swiftly deal damage. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Floodpits Drowner provides additional disruption and tempo advantage. With a versatile land base and a mix of powerful creatures and spells, this Dimir Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck includes cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to deal damage quickly, while also using spells like Play with Fire and Wizard's Lightning for removal and reach. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana ramp and flexibility in casting spells. Overall, this deck aims to establish a fast and aggressive board presence, forcing opponents to react or risk falling behind.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate massive value and overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Axe while setting up the combo pieces. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out help with card advantage and disruption, while Bitter Triumph provides additional win condition. The deck is streamlined with a mix of lands that enable the color requirements of the combo pieces, ensuring consistency in executing the game plan.

This control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, and powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also utilizes a land package of Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber, along with various dual lands, to ensure consistent mana production. With card advantage from Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and a mix of removal and threats, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent until it can close out the game with its powerful creatures.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of hand disruption, creature removal, and land destruction. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict take care of threats on the board. The deck also includes cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Reckoner Bankbuster to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a focus on resource denial and disruption, this Mono Black Control deck looks to grind out victories by outlasting and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the Lotus Field combo while using cards like Sleight of Hand, Pore Over the Pages, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to dig for key pieces. By untapping Lotus Field with cards like Hidden Strings and Thespian's Stage, the deck generates massive amounts of mana to cast powerful spells like Dig Through Time or create oppressive board states. The inclusion of Boseiju, Who Endures helps protect combo pieces from counterspells, while Artist's Talent gives the deck additional utility and flexibility in different matchups.

Utilizing Lotus Field as the centerpiece, this deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving untapping lands, generating large amounts of mana, and casting game-winning spells. By leveraging cards like Thespian's Stage, Hidden Strings, and Pore Over the Pages, the deck aims to quickly ramp up to play game-ending threats such as Emergent Ultimatum or Omniscience. With a mix of control elements like Bala Ged Recovery and Archdruid's Charm, as well as protection from cards like Spara's Headquarters and Boseiju, Who Endures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays.

The deck is focused on quickly bringing back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard while controlling the board with low-cost spells and cantrips. By utilizing cards like Consider, Opt, and Sleight of Hand to dig through the deck, while also having removal options like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe, the deck aims to maintain a constant stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of damage-based removal and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and resource management.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays utilizing the power of Rakdos creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Archfiend of the Dross, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Unstoppable Slasher, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the board and deal maximum damage to the opponent quickly. The mana base is set up to ensure a smooth curve and consistency in playing cards, making it a fast and efficient Aggro deck in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes a companion for additional benefits. The strategy involves using efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with powerful burn spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage, to apply pressure and win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands to ensure consistent mana access for both colors in the Rakdos color combination.
